PropertySetDef.Name: Pset_SwitchingDeviceTypeSwitchDisconnector
PropertySetDef.Definition: A switch disconnector is a switch which in the open position satisfies the isolating requirements specified for a disconnector.\X\0D \X\0D History: Property 'HasVisualIndication' changed to 'IsIlluminated' to conform with property name for toggle switch

PropertyDef.Name: LoadDisconnectionType
PropertyDef.Definition: A list of the available types of load disconnection from which that required may be selected.

PropertyDef.Name: SwitchDisconnectorType
PropertyDef.Definition: A list of the available types of switch disconnector from which that required may be selected where:\X\0D \X\0D CenterBreak: A disconnector in which both contacts of each pole are movable and engage at a point substantially midway between their supports. (IEC 441-14-08)\X\0D DividedSupport: A disconnector in which the fixed and moving contacts of each pole are not supported by a common base or frame. (IEC 441-14-06)\X\0D DoubleBreak: A disconnector that opens a circuit at two points. (IEC 441-14-09)\X\0D EarthingSwitch: A disconnector in which the fixed and moving contacts of each pole are not supported by a common base or frame. (IEC 441-14-07)\X\0D Isolator: A disconnector which in the open position satisfies isolating requirements. (IEC 441-14-12)
